com.matrixone.apps.domain.util
Class DateUtil

java.lang.Object
  com.matrixone.apps.domain.util.DateUtil

public class DateUtil
extends java.lang.Object

The DateUtil class represents the class which has static methods to evaluate start date, finish date, duration

Version:
AEF 9.5.1.3 - Copyright (c) 2002, MatrixOne, Inc.

computeDuration

public static long computeDuration(java.util.Date startDate,
                                   java.util.Date finishDate)
Given a Start Date and a Finish Date return durationon treating weekends as non-working days.

Parameters:
startDate - Date object indicating start date
finishDate - Date object indicating finish date
Returns:
duration long duration in milli-seconds
Since:
AEF 9.5.1.3

                                               long duration)
Given a Start Date and Duration return a Finish Date treating weekends as non-working days.

duration - long duration in milli-seconds
Returns:
Date finish date
Since:
AEF 9.5.1.3

computeStartDate

public static java.util.Date computeStartDate(java.util.Date finishDate,
                                              long duration)
Given a Finish Date and Duration return a Start Date treating weekends as non-working days.

Parameters:
finishDate - Date object indicating finish date
duration - long duration in milli-seconds
Returns:
Date start date
Since:
AEF 9.5.1.3

computeFinishDate

public static java.util.Date computeFinishDate(java.util.Date startDate,
                                               int durationYears,
                                               int durationMonths)
Given a Start Date, duration in years and duration in months, returns a Finish Date. Note that this do not skip week ends and holidays.

Parameters:
startDate - Date object indicating finish date
durationYears - int duration indicating number of years
Returns:
durationMonths int duration indicating number of months
Since:
AEF 9.5.1.3

computeIntervalDates

public static java.util.ArrayList computeIntervalDates(java.util.Date startDate,
                                                       java.util.Date finishDate,
                                                       java.lang.String interval)
This returns an ArrayList of Dates between startDate and finishDate based on the interval type. Note that weekends and holidays are not skipped.

Parameters:
startDate - starting Date of the interval
finishDate - finishing Date of the interval
interval - String indicating type of interval: MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, WEEKLY
Returns:
ArrayList an ArrayList of dates
Since:
AEF 9.5.1.3

                            throws FrameworkException

Parameters:

iDateFormat - date format LONG/FULL/MIDIUM/SHORT
iClientTimeOffset - client time zone
locale - user locale
Returns:
long milliseconds value
Throws:
FrameworkException - if the operation fails
